object.property: FileSystem template that uses Windows WMI.
The % Processor Time counter provides a measure of how much time the processor actually spends working on productive threads and how often it was busy servicing requests.
It reports the percentage of time that the selected disk drive is busy servicing read requests.
It indicates the rate at which bytes are written and is the primary measure of disk throughput.
It reports the percentage of time that the selected disk drive is busy servicing write requests.
Reports the amount of bytes on the disk that are not allocated. This reporst on LogicalDisks.There is no Free Megabytes counter for the PhysicalDisk object.
When the value drops below the minimum value an event is sent.
Ethernet interface template that uses Windows WMI.
This is how many bytes you get from the NIC.
This is how many bytes of data are sent to the NIC.
Shows the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.
Shows the rate at which packets are received on the network interface.
Shows the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.
Shows the rate at which packets are sent on the network interface.
This template uses Windows WMI to collect standard Windows metrics (cpu, memory, paging, etc.)

The Available Memory counter indicates the amount of memory that is left after nonpaged pool allocations, paged pool allocations, process' working sets, and the file system cache have all taken their piece.
Committed memory is the physical memory in use for which space has been reserved in the paging file should it need to be written to disk.
The total number of pages read from disk to resolve hard page faults.
This shows how many memory pages were written to the pagefile to free RAM page frames for other purposes each second.
The % Usage Peak counter indicates how much of the paging file is being used.
The percentage of time a process was running in privileged mode See "Processes in a Bottleneck" later in this chapter.
The percentage of time the processor was busy servicing a specific process.
The percentage of time a process was running in user mode.
This is the value for how the long the system has been running
['Context Switches per Sec_Context Switches per Sec']
Gather Windows Event Log messages and convert them to Zenoss events.
Gather Windows Event Log messages and convert them to Zenoss events.
Gather information about running Windows services.
Gather information about running Windows services.
